result.markdown:
--- title: Abundance from Mark-Recapture Data subtitle: Wisconsin YOY Walleye description: Use multiple census mark-recapture techniques to estimate abundance of YOY Walleye in Pine Lake (WI). author: Derek H. Ogle date: 3/8/2019 image: ../../../helpers/img/exercise.png categories: - " Exercise" - " Mark-Recapture" - " Abundance" - "Walleye" --- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: @mraz_1968 examined the population dynamics of young-of-the-year (YOY) [walleye](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Walleye) (*Sander vitreus*) in Pine Lake, an inland lake in Wisconsin. In fall 1962, YOY walleye were captured, marked, and returned to the lake on five sampling dates. On each date, the number of fish caught, the number of caught fish that were previously marked, and the number of marked fish returned to the lake were recorded. The results from these sampling efforts are shown in the table below. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Sample Caught Recaptured Returned
1 321 -- 321
2 412 45 412
3 178 55 178
4 415 93 415
5 367 113 --
````` ::: ::: Use these results to answer the following questions. 1. Estimate the initial population size, with 95% confidence interval, of YOY Walleye in Pine Lake. Carefully interpret the result. 1. Comment on the validity of the assumptions for the model you used to estimate the size of the population. :::{.callout-important appearance="simple"} ## Solution Code: Available upon request to students not in a class. Contact fishR maintainers. ::: ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} :::
